greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 2 followed by a run of n 1's.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = 2 if n is a triangular number, otherwise 1.
mathematica: Table[(SquaresR[1, 8*n + 1] + 2)/2, {n, 0, 100}] (* or *) Table[Floor[(3 - Cos[Pi*Sqrt[8*n + 1]])/2], {n,0,100}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 14 2017 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
